title: Contributions to All The Year Round
notes: Author unknown; collection of miscellaneous essays from a Victorian periodical. No clear contemplative focus identified. Likely included due to vague thematic overlap or misclassification.

title: The Odyssey of Homer
author: Homer

title: Old Court Life in Spain, vol. 2/2

title: The Complete Poetical Works of Samuel Taylor Coleridge. Vol 1 and 2
author: Coleridge, Samuel Taylor
notes: Coleridge's poetry, especially 'The Rime of the Ancient Mariner' and 'Kubla Khan', contains profound mystical and contemplative imagery. While not a direct spiritual teaching, his work resonates with themes of inner awareness, the sublime, and the veil between worlds. Christian mystical undertones are present, particularly in his later works. Not primarily advaitic or eastern, but valuable as a western poetic counterpart to contemplative themes.

title: The Pain and Sorrow of Evil Marriage
author: Worde, Wynkyn de

author: Besant, Annie

author: Virgil
